Package ohos.agp.text

Class Font.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.Font.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Font

    public static class Font.Builder
extends Object
    Provides a builder to create a Font instance.

    You can use it to create a Font instance by specifying the text style.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int MAX_FALLBACK_NUM
      Specifies the maximum number of FontFamily objects allowed in the custom fallback list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Builder​(File file)
      Creates a Builder instance with specified font file.
      Builder​(FileDescriptor fileDescriptor)
      Creates a Font object based on the file descriptor.
      Builder​(String name)
      Creates a Builder instance with specified font family.
      Builder​(Font font)
      Creates a Font object based on the existing Font object.
      Builder​(FontFamily fontFamily)
      Creates a font based on the specified fontFamily.
      Builder​(ResourceManager resourceManager, String path)
      Creates a Font object based on the specified font file (from the Resource Manager).

        public static final int MAX_FALLBACK_NUM
        Specifies the maximum number of FontFamily objects allowed in the custom fallback list.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder​(String name)
        Creates a Builder instance with specified font family.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the font family specified for the Builder instance.

      • Builder

        public Builder​(File file)
        Creates a Builder instance with specified font file.
        Parameters:
        file - Indicates the font file specified for the Builder instance.

      • Builder

        public Builder​(FileDescriptor fileDescriptor)
        Creates a Font object based on the file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        fileDescriptor - Indicates the font file descriptor.
        Since:
        7

      • Builder

        public Builder​(ResourceManager resourceManager,
               String path)
        Creates a Font object based on the specified font file (from the Resource Manager).
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - Indicates the Resource Manager. You can use getResourceManager() to obtain the Resource Manager.
        path - Indicates the path of the font file. The font file is stored in the rawfile directory, for example, resources/rawfile/your_font_file.ttf.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified resourceManager or path is null.
        Since:
        7

      • Builder

        public Builder​(Font font)
        Creates a Font object based on the existing Font object.

        Then, you can obtain Font objects of different styles by specifying the font weight and italic style.

        Parameters:
        font - Indicates the existing Font object. The default font will be used if this parameter is null.
        Since:
        7

      • Builder

        public Builder​(FontFamily fontFamily)
        Creates a font based on the specified fontFamily.
        Parameters:
        fontFamily - Indicates the FontFamily object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified fontFamily is null.
        Since:
        7

    • Method Detail

      • makeItalic

        public Font.Builder makeItalic​(boolean italic)
        Italicizes the font to be built.
        Parameters:
        italic - Specifies whether to italicize the font, true means to italicize the font, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.

      • setWeight

        public Font.Builder setWeight​(int weight)
        Sets the font weight of the font to be built.
        Parameters:
        weight - Indicates the font weight to set. The value ranges from 1 to 1000. Commonly used weights includes Font.REGULAR, Font.MEDIUM and Font.BOLD.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.

      • build

        public Font build​()
        Creates a font object based on the specified style.
        Returns:
        Returns the font object with the specified style.

      • setSystemFallback

        public Font.Builder setSystemFallback​(String fontFamilyName)
        Searches for the system fallback list matching the specified fontFamilyName and uses it as the fallback list of the font to be created.

        A custom fallback (if available) takes precedence over the system fallback list.

        Parameters:
        fontFamilyName - Indicates the font family name specified. It is used to search for the system fallback list.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified fontFamilyName is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the family name and font objects are specified as Builder parameters.
        Since:
        7

      • addCustomFallback

        public Font.Builder addCustomFallback​(FontFamily fontFamily)
        Adds the specified fontFamily to the custom fallback list.

        A maximum of 64 FontFamilys (Include the one passed in the constructor).

        Parameters:
        fontFamily - Indicates the FontFamily to be added to the custom fallback list.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified fontFamily is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the number of FontFamily objects is 0 or exceeds the upper limit.
        Since:
        7

      • setFontCollectionIndex

        public Font.Builder setFontCollectionIndex​(int fontCollectionIndex)
        Sets the index of the font collection. Note: When calling this method, you must know the valid index range of the corresponding font collection file. The value 0 is always valid.
        Parameters:
        fontCollectionIndex - Indicates the index of the font collection. Ensure that the index is valid. The value 0 is always valid.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if no font file is specified as the Builder parameter.
        Since:
        7

      • setFontVariations

        public Font.Builder setFontVariations​(String variations)
        Specifies the settings of the font variation axis. Note: When calling this method, you must know the valid variation axes of the corresponding font file and the valid ranges of the values.
        Parameters:
        variations - Indicates the font variation axis to set. For example, the string "'wght' 400,'ital' 1" means that the font is in italics and the font weight is 400.
        Returns:
        Returns the builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the specified variations is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if no font file is specified as the Builder parameter.
        Since:
        7
